707859f-a.title: Manhattan: 2nd Ave. - 39th St. E.
707859f-a.text:
Second Avenue, northward from E. 39th Street (lower fore-
ground and not seen) as viewed from atop No. 3Ol E. E8th Street.
In the foreground is a clearance between F9th and 4Oth Streets and
which is shown solely in No. 2. To the north are structures
around 42nd Street; the News Building being that on the left. Be-
yond this is the Crystal Building at the S.W. corner of 43rd Street.
To the right are units of Tudor City with its Hotel Woodstock
only partially shown. Note the slight widening of tue ''E1'' tracks
at the 42nd Street station.
September 11, 1931
Views 1 and 2
P.L. Snerr
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

707863f-a.text:

Edison stacks across clearing on east side of Second Avenue.
April 8, 1931
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS

712536f-a.text:
E. S9th Sttreet (foreground, center ) west from SSecond
Avenue as viewed from the roof top of No. 3O1 E. 38th Street.
Ooer towerinn the East Side tenements are the Grand Cen tral
aalvarraner', promiunemt of w-4ch are )0 'nae d0h Straet

712535f-a.title: Manhattan: 39th Street - 2nd Avenue
712535f-a.text:
(1)
39th Street, north side, east of Second Avenue, where buildings
have just been demolished; the view is northwest, showing the
Chanin, Chrysler, and Daily News Buildings.
September 11, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same and showing the rears of Nos. 314 to 322 East 40th
Street.
September 11, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

712525f-a.title: Manhattan: 39th Street (East) - 2nd Avenue
712525f-a.text:
East 39th Street, north side, east from (No. 331), but not including
Second Ave., to the East River. Prominently shown, is one of the pover
houses of the N.Y. Edison Co. Plant.
April 8, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

707862f-b.title: Manhattan: 2nd Ave. - 39th St. E.
707862f-b.text:
Second Avenue, at the N. E. corner of East 39th Street, show-
ing the extensive cleared space there. Part of this site is used
as a car parking lot. Across same appear units of Tudor City and
a generating plant of the Consolidated Edison Company.
June 7, 1940
Views 1,2
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS
